intro: Haplophyllum linifolium var. rosmarinifolium, commonly known as the rosmarinifolium variant of the genus Haplophyllum, is a shrub characterized by its aromatic, needle-like leaves. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is native to specific regions in southern Africa. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late summer. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils. The species is noted for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in well-drained, acidic soils.
